verses.verse: For He (Job 29:12) will deliver the needy when he cries, The poor also, and him who has no helper.
He will spare the poor and needy, And will save the souls of the needy.
He will redeem their life from oppression and violence; And (1 Sam. 26:21; (Ps. 116:15)) precious shall be their blood in His sight.
And He shall live; And the gold of (Is. 60:6) Sheba will be given to Him; Prayer also will be made for Him continually, And daily He shall be praised.
There will be an abundance of grain in the earth, On the top of the mountains; Its fruit shall wave like Lebanon; (1 Kin. 4:20) And those of the city shall flourish like grass of the earth.
((Ps. 89:36)) His name shall endure forever; His name shall continue as long as the sun. And ((Gen. 12:3)) men shall be blessed in Him; (Luke 1:48) All nations shall call Him blessed.
(1 Chr. 29:10) Blessed be the LORD God, the God of Israel, (Ex. 15:11; Job 5:9) Who only does wondrous things!
And ((Neh. 9:5)) blessed be His glorious name forever! (Num. 14:21; Hab. 2:14) And let the whole earth be filled with His glory. Amen and Amen.
The prayers of David the son of Jesse are ended.
BOOK THREE: 230 73-89The Tragedy of the Wicked, and the Blessedness of Trust in God A Psalm of (Ps. 50:title) Asaph. [1] Truly God is good to Israel, To such as are pure in heart.
But as for me, my feet had almost stumbled; My steps had nearly (Job 12:5) slipped.
(Ps. 37:1, 7; (Prov. 23:17)) For I was envious of the boastful, When I saw the prosperity of the (Job 21:5-16; Jer. 12:1) wicked.
For there are no pangs in their death, But their strength is firm.
(Job 21:9) They are not in trouble as other men, Nor are they plagued like other men.
Therefore pride serves as their necklace; Violence covers them (Ps. 109:18) like a garment.
(Job 15:27; Jer. 5:28) Their eyes bulge with abundance; They have more than heart could wish.
(Ps. 53:1) They scoff and speak wickedly concerning oppression; They (2 Pet. 2:18; Jude 16) speak loftily.
They set their mouth (Rev. 13:6) against the heavens, And their tongue walks through the earth.
Therefore his people return here, ((Ps. 75:8)) And waters of a full cup are drained by them.
And they say, (Job 22:13) “How does God know? And is there knowledge in the Most High?”
Behold, these are the ungodly, Who are always at ease; They increase in riches.
Surely I have cleansed my heart in (Job 21:15; 35:3; Mal. 3:14) vain, And washed my hands in innocence.
For all day long I have been plagued, And chastened every morning.
If I had said, “I will speak thus,” Behold, I would have been untrue to the generation of Your children.
When I thought how to understand this, It was too painful for me—
Until I went into the sanctuary of God; Then I understood their ((Ps. 37:38; 55:23)) end.
Surely (Ps. 35:6) You set them in slippery places; You cast them down to destruction.
Oh, how they are brought to desolation, as in a moment! They are utterly consumed with terrors.
